content: emotional support pickle thank you for your interest in my pattern this pattern has not been tested so if you find typographical or numerical errors please inform me so i can correct it i can be contacted via facebook or instagram happy hooking finished size about 3 tall and 2 wide materials worsted weight #4 yarn in 6mm safety eyes green ~25 yards glass beads or other weighted small piece of light green yarn item 3 5mm hook pen & paper for the sign or you needle can print the template below scissors hole punch gauge not necessary but your finished size may vary stitches us terms slip_stitch -slip_stitch decrease -decrease st -stitch 2-dcbbls -two double_crochet chain -chain bobbles essentially you just single_crochet -single_crochet make a double_crochet-decrease inside the same increase -increase stitch so you don t actually decrease pattern notes the body is worked in continuous rounds the arms are worked in row # single_crochet means one single_crochet in each stitch for # stitches designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items body step 1 leaving a 12-inch tail round 1 in a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 2 *increase* 6 times 12 3 *single_crochet increase* 6 times 18 4 13 10 rounds single_crochet in each st* *as you crochet these rounds randomly add 2-dcbbls in place of a single_crochet for texture 14 *single_crochet decrease* 6 times 12 attach eyes between rounds 5 & 6 with 2 stitches in between stuff pickle adding glass beads or other weight to the bottom of the pickle 15 *decrease* 6 times leave tail to cinch bottom closed 6 using light green yarn sew mouth between rounds 7 & 8 and 2 stitches wide step 2 pull the starting tail out of the middle top chain 4 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook and in next 2 chs slip_stitch to top of head fasten_off weave in end arm make 2 leaving a five-inch tail row 1 in a magic_ring 1 single_crochet turn 1 2 chain 1 increase turn 2 3 7 5 row chain 1 2 single_crochet turn fasten_off after row 7 leaving long tail for sewing designed by crochet by those_yellow_things your source for unique handmade items sign you can create your own or print out the template below if you use the template make sure your printer settings are set at 100% i recommend printing on cardstock rectangle size 1 8 wide x 1 3 tall life isn t always all bread & butter so this pickle will help cut out the rectangle à you dill with all that using a hole punch punch out the grey circles life throws your way assembly using the starting tail from arms sew through the hole-punched hole on the sign twice hide tail and fasten_off repeat with other arm using the ending tail from arms sew arms at either side of body between rounds 10- 12 hide tail and fasten_off repeat with other arm additional templates life isn t always all life
